71
A WILL MADE DURING A STATE OF EMERGENCY OR A STATE OF WAR
(1) During a state of emergency or a state of war, a commander of a company or a unit of equal or higher rank, or another person in the presence of such a commander, may draw up a will for a military person in accordance with the provisions applying to the making of a will in court.
(2) A will made under the conditions referred to in the preceding paragraph shall no longer be valid sixty days after the state of emergency or state of war ends; if the testator's military service ceases prior to or after that time, the will shall become invalid thirty days after the cessation of the testator's military service.
